1‚Üí# üöÄ Deployment Guide - AI Accountant App
     2‚Üí
     3‚ÜíThis guide provides step-by-step instructions for deploying your AI Accountant application to popular hosting services.
     4‚Üí
     5‚Üí## üìã Table of Contents
     6‚Üí
     7‚Üí1. [Vercel Deployment](#vercel-deployment)
     8‚Üí2. [Netlify Deployment](#netlify-deployment)
     9‚Üí3. [GitHub Pages Deployment](#github-pages-deployment)
    10‚Üí4. [Environment Variables](#environment-variables)
    11‚Üí5. [Build Verification](#build-verification)
    12‚Üí
    13‚Üí---
    14‚Üí
    15‚Üí## üî∑ Vercel Deployment
    16‚Üí
    17‚Üí**Vercel** is the recommended hosting platform for Vite + React applications. It offers automatic builds, instant deployments, and excellent performance.
    18‚Üí
    19‚Üí### Method 1: Deploy via Vercel Dashboard (Recommended)
    20‚Üí
    21‚Üí1. **Create Vercel Account**
    22‚Üí   - Visit [vercel.com](https://vercel.com)
    23‚Üí   - Sign up with GitHub, GitLab, or Bitbucket
    24‚Üí
    25‚Üí2. **Import Your Project**
    26‚Üí   - Click "Add New Project"
    27‚Üí   - Select "Import Git Repository"
    28‚Üí   - Authorize Vercel to access your repository
    29‚Üí   - Select your project repository
    30‚Üí
    31‚Üí3. **Configure Build Settings**
    32‚Üí   - Framework Preset: **Vite**
    33‚Üí   - Build Command: `npm run build`
    34‚Üí   - Output Directory: `dist`
    35‚Üí   - Install Command: `npm install`
    36‚Üí
    37‚Üí4. **Add Environment Variables** (if needed)
    38‚Üí   - Click "Environment Variables"
    39‚Üí   - Add `TENANT_ID` if using multi-tenant setup
    40‚Üí
    41‚Üí5. **Deploy**
    42‚Üí   - Click "Deploy"
    43‚Üí   - Wait 1-2 minutes for build completion
    44‚Üí   - Your app will be live at `https://your-app.vercel.app`
    45‚Üí
    46‚Üí### Method 2: Deploy via Vercel CLI
    47‚Üí
    48‚Üí```bash
    49‚Üí# Install Vercel CLI
    50‚Üínpm install -g vercel
    51‚Üí
    52‚Üí# Login to Vercel
    53‚Üívercel login
    54‚Üí
    55‚Üí# Deploy to production
    56‚Üívercel --prod
    57‚Üí```
    58‚Üí
    59‚Üí### Automatic Deployments
    60‚Üí
    61‚ÜíEvery push to your main branch will automatically deploy to production. Pull requests get preview deployments.
    62‚Üí
    63‚Üí**Vercel Configuration:** `vercel.json` (already configured)
    64‚Üí
    65‚Üí---
    66‚Üí
    67‚Üí## üî∂ Netlify Deployment
    68‚Üí
    69‚Üí**Netlify** is another excellent option with similar features to Vercel.
    70‚Üí
    71‚Üí### Method 1: Deploy via Netlify Dashboard
    72‚Üí
    73‚Üí1. **Create Netlify Account**
    74‚Üí   - Visit [netlify.com](https://netlify.com)
    75‚Üí   - Sign up with GitHub, GitLab, or Bitbucket
    76‚Üí
    77‚Üí2. **Import Your Project**
    78‚Üí   - Click "Add new site" ‚Üí "Import an existing project"
    79‚Üí   - Select Git provider and authorize Netlify
    80‚Üí   - Choose your repository
    81‚Üí
    82‚Üí3. **Configure Build Settings**
    83‚Üí   - Build command: `npm run build`
    84‚Üí   - Publish directory: `dist`
    85‚Üí   - Node version: `20`
    86‚Üí
    87‚Üí4. **Add Environment Variables** (if needed)
    88‚Üí   - Go to Site Settings ‚Üí Environment Variables
    89‚Üí   - Add `TENANT_ID` if using multi-tenant setup
    90‚Üí
    91‚Üí5. **Deploy**
    92‚Üí   - Click "Deploy site"
    93‚Üí   - Your app will be live at `https://your-app.netlify.app`
    94‚Üí
    95‚Üí### Method 2: Deploy via Netlify CLI
    96‚Üí
    97‚Üí```bash
    98‚Üí# Install Netlify CLI
    99‚Üínpm install -g netlify-cli
   100‚Üí
   101‚Üí# Login to Netlify
   102‚Üínetlify login
   103‚Üí
   104‚Üí# Initialize and deploy
   105‚Üínetlify init
   106‚Üí
   107‚Üí# Or deploy manually
   108‚Üínetlify deploy --prod
   109‚Üí```
   110‚Üí
   111‚Üí### Automatic Deployments
   112‚Üí
   113‚ÜíEvery push to your main branch triggers automatic deployment.
   114‚Üí
   115‚Üí**Netlify Configuration:** `netlify.toml` (already configured)
   116‚Üí
   117‚Üí---
   118‚Üí
   119‚Üí## üîπ GitHub Pages Deployment
   120‚Üí
   121‚ÜíFor free static hosting on GitHub:
   122‚Üí
   123‚Üí### Step 1: Install gh-pages
   124‚Üí
   125‚Üí```bash
   126‚Üínpm install --save-dev gh-pages
   127‚Üí```
   128‚Üí
   129‚Üí### Step 2: Update package.json
   130‚Üí
   131‚ÜíAdd these scripts to `package.json`:
   132‚Üí
   133‚Üí```json
   134‚Üí{
   135‚Üí  "scripts": {
   136‚Üí    "predeploy": "npm run build",
   137‚Üí    "deploy": "gh-pages -d dist"
   138‚Üí  },
   139‚Üí  "homepage": "https://<username>.github.io/<repository-name>"
   140‚Üí}
   141‚Üí```
   142‚Üí
   143‚Üí### Step 3: Update vite.config.js
   144‚Üí
   145‚Üí```javascript
   146‚Üíexport default defineConfig({
   147‚Üí  base: '/<repository-name>/',
   148‚Üí  // ... rest of config
   149‚Üí})
   150‚Üí```
   151‚Üí
   152‚Üí### Step 4: Deploy
   153‚Üí
   154‚Üí```bash
   155‚Üínpm run deploy
   156‚Üí```
   157‚Üí
   158‚ÜíYour app will be live at `https://<username>.github.io/<repository-name>`
   159‚Üí
   160‚Üí---
   161‚Üí
   162‚Üí## üîê Environment Variables
   163‚Üí
   164‚ÜíIf your app uses environment variables, configure them in your hosting platform:
   165‚Üí
   166‚Üí### Vercel
   167‚Üí- Dashboard: Project Settings ‚Üí Environment Variables
   168‚Üí- CLI: Use `.env` file or `vercel env` command
   169‚Üí
   170‚Üí### Netlify
   171‚Üí- Dashboard: Site Settings ‚Üí Environment Variables
   172‚Üí- CLI: Use `.env` file or `netlify env:set`
   173‚Üí
   174‚Üí### GitHub Pages
   175‚Üí- Use GitHub Secrets for build-time variables
   176‚Üí- Go to Repository Settings ‚Üí Secrets and Variables ‚Üí Actions
   177‚Üí
   178‚Üí### Common Variables
   179‚Üí
   180‚Üí```bash
   181‚Üí# Multi-tenant setup (if needed)
   182‚ÜíTENANT_ID=your-tenant-id
   183‚Üí
   184‚Üí# API endpoints (if needed)
   185‚ÜíVITE_API_URL=https://api.yourapp.com
   186‚Üí
   187‚Üí# Payment credentials (use production keys)
   188‚ÜíVITE_STRIPE_PUBLIC_KEY=pk_live_xxxxx
   189‚ÜíVITE_PAYPAL_CLIENT_ID=your-production-client-id
   190‚Üí```
   191‚Üí
   192‚Üí---
   193‚Üí
   194‚Üí## ‚úÖ Build Verification
   195‚Üí
   196‚ÜíBefore deploying, verify your build works locally:
   197‚Üí
   198‚Üí### Step 1: Run Type Checking
   199‚Üí
   200‚Üí```bash
   201‚Üínpm run check:safe
   202‚Üí```
   203‚Üí
   204‚Üí### Step 2: Build the Project
   205‚Üí
   206‚Üí```bash
   207‚Üínpm run build
   208‚Üí```
   209‚Üí
   210‚Üí### Step 3: Preview Production Build
   211‚Üí
   212‚Üí```bash
   213‚Üínpm run serve
   214‚Üí```
   215‚Üí
   216‚ÜíVisit `http://localhost:4173` to test the production build.
   217‚Üí
   218‚Üí### Expected Output
   219‚Üí
   220‚Üí```
   221‚Üí‚úì built in 15s
   222‚Üí‚úì 150 chunks transformed
   223‚Üídist/index.html                   1.20 kB
   224‚Üídist/assets/index-abc123.css      45.2 kB
   225‚Üídist/assets/index-xyz789.js      425.8 kB
   226‚Üí```
   227‚Üí
   228‚Üí---
   229‚Üí
   230‚Üí## üéØ Quick Start Summary
   231‚Üí
   232‚Üí### Fastest Deployment (Vercel)
   233‚Üí
   234‚Üí```bash
   235‚Üí# 1. Install Vercel CLI
   236‚Üínpm install -g vercel
   237‚Üí
   238‚Üí# 2. Login
   239‚Üívercel login
   240‚Üí
   241‚Üí# 3. Deploy
   242‚Üívercel --prod
   243‚Üí```
   244‚Üí
   245‚Üí### Custom Domain Setup
   246‚Üí
   247‚Üí**Vercel:**
   248‚Üí1. Go to Project Settings ‚Üí Domains
   249‚Üí2. Add your custom domain
   250‚Üí3. Update DNS records as instructed
   251‚Üí
   252‚Üí**Netlify:**
   253‚Üí1. Go to Site Settings ‚Üí Domain Management
   254‚Üí2. Add custom domain
   255‚Üí3. Update DNS records as instructed
   256‚Üí
   257‚Üí---
   258‚Üí
   259‚Üí## üîç Troubleshooting
   260‚Üí
   261‚Üí### Build Fails
   262‚Üí
   263‚Üí- Check Node version (requires Node 20+)
   264‚Üí- Run `npm install` to ensure dependencies are installed
   265‚Üí- Run `npm run check:safe` locally first
   266‚Üí- Check build logs for specific errors
   267‚Üí
   268‚Üí### Blank Page After Deployment
   269‚Üí
   270‚Üí- Check browser console for errors
   271‚Üí- Verify `base` path in `vite.config.js`
   272‚Üí- Ensure routing redirects are configured
   273‚Üí
   274‚Üí### 404 Errors on Page Refresh
   275‚Üí
   276‚Üí- Verify redirect rules are configured:
   277‚Üí  - Vercel: Check `vercel.json`
   278‚Üí  - Netlify: Check `netlify.toml`
   279‚Üí
   280‚Üí### Environment Variables Not Working
   281‚Üí
   282‚Üí- Use `VITE_` prefix for runtime variables
   283‚Üí- Rebuild after adding variables
   284‚Üí- Check variable names match exactly
   285‚Üí
   286‚Üí---
   287‚Üí
   288‚Üí## üìä Performance Optimization
   289‚Üí
   290‚ÜíBoth Vercel and Netlify automatically provide:
   291‚Üí
   292‚Üí‚úÖ **CDN distribution** (global edge network)
   293‚Üí‚úÖ **Automatic HTTPS** (SSL certificates)
   294‚Üí‚úÖ **Gzip/Brotli compression**
   295‚Üí‚úÖ **HTTP/2 support**
   296‚Üí‚úÖ **Automatic asset caching**
   297‚Üí‚úÖ **DDoS protection**
   298‚Üí
   299‚Üí---

# üöÄ Deployment Guide - AI Accountant App

This guide provides step-by-step instructions for deploying your AI Accountant application to popular hosting services.

## üìã Table of Contents

1. [Vercel Deployment](#vercel-deployment)
2. [Netlify Deployment](#netlify-deployment)
3. [GitHub Pages Deployment](#github-pages-deployment)
4. [Environment Variables](#environment-variables)
5. [Build Verification](#build-verification)

---

## üî∑ Vercel Deployment

**Vercel** is the recommended hosting platform for Vite + React applications. It offers automatic builds, instant deployments, and excellent performance.

### Method 1: Deploy via Vercel Dashboard (Recommended)

1. **Create Vercel Account**
   - Visit [vercel.com](https://vercel.com)
   - Sign up with GitHub, GitLab, or Bitbucket

2. **Import Your Project**
   - Click "Add New Project"
   - Select "Import Git Repository"
   - Authorize Vercel to access your repository
   - Select your project repository

3. **Configure Build Settings**
   - Framework Preset: **Vite**
   - Build Command: `npm run build`
   - Output Directory: `dist`
   - Install Command: `npm install`

4. **Add Environment Variables** (if needed)
   - Click "Environment Variables"
   - Add `TENANT_ID` if using multi-tenant setup

5. **Deploy**
   - Click "Deploy"
   - Wait 1-2 minutes for build completion
   - Your app will be live at `https://your-app.vercel.app`

### Method 2: Deploy via Vercel CLI

```bash
# Install Vercel CLI
npm install -g vercel

# Login to Vercel
vercel login

# Deploy to production
vercel --prod
```

### Automatic Deployments

Every push to your main branch will automatically deploy to production. Pull requests get preview deployments.

**Vercel Configuration:** `vercel.json` (already configured)

---

## üî∂ Netlify Deployment

**Netlify** is another excellent option with similar features to Vercel.

### Method 1: Deploy via Netlify Dashboard

1. **Create Netlify Account**
   - Visit [netlify.com](https://netlify.com)
   - Sign up with GitHub, GitLab, or Bitbucket

2. **Import Your Project**
   - Click "Add new site" ‚Üí "Import an existing project"
   - Select Git provider and authorize Netlify
   - Choose your repository

3. **Configure Build Settings**
   - Build command: `npm run build`
   - Publish directory: `dist`
   - Node version: `20`

4. **Add Environment Variables** (if needed)
   - Go to Site Settings ‚Üí Environment Variables
   - Add `TENANT_ID` if using multi-tenant setup

5. **Deploy**
   - Click "Deploy site"
   - Your app will be live at `https://your-app.netlify.app`

### Method 2: Deploy via Netlify CLI

```bash
# Install Netlify CLI
npm install -g netlify-cli

# Login to Netlify
netlify login

# Initialize and deploy
netlify init

# Or deploy manually
netlify deploy --prod
```

### Automatic Deployments

Every push to your main branch triggers automatic deployment.

**Netlify Configuration:** `netlify.toml` (already configured)

---

## üîπ GitHub Pages Deployment

For free static hosting on GitHub:

### Step 1: Install gh-pages

```bash
npm install --save-dev gh-pages
```

### Step 2: Update package.json

Add these scripts to `package.json`:

```json
{
  "scripts": {
    "predeploy": "npm run build",
    "deploy": "gh-pages -d dist"
  },
  "homepage": "https://<username>.github.io/<repository-name>"
}
```

### Step 3: Update vite.config.js

```javascript
export default defineConfig({
  base: '/<repository-name>/',
  // ... rest of config
})
```

### Step 4: Deploy

```bash
npm run deploy
```

Your app will be live at `https://<username>.github.io/<repository-name>`

---

## üîê Environment Variables

If your app uses environment variables, configure them in your hosting platform:

### Vercel
- Dashboard: Project Settings ‚Üí Environment Variables
- CLI: Use `.env` file or `vercel env` command

### Netlify
- Dashboard: Site Settings ‚Üí Environment Variables
- CLI: Use `.env` file or `netlify env:set`

### GitHub Pages
- Use GitHub Secrets for build-time variables
- Go to Repository Settings ‚Üí Secrets and Variables ‚Üí Actions

### Common Variables

```bash
# Multi-tenant setup (if needed)
TENANT_ID=your-tenant-id

# API endpoints (if needed)
VITE_API_URL=https://api.yourapp.com

# Payment credentials (use production keys)
VITE_STRIPE_PUBLIC_KEY=pk_live_xxxxx
VITE_PAYPAL_CLIENT_ID=your-production-client-id
```

---

## ‚úÖ Build Verification

Before deploying, verify your build works locally:

### Step 1: Run Type Checking

```bash
npm run check:safe
```

### Step 2: Build the Project

```bash
npm run build
```

### Step 3: Preview Production Build

```bash
npm run serve
```

Visit `http://localhost:4173` to test the production build.

### Expected Output

```
‚úì built in 15s
‚úì 150 chunks transformed
dist/index.html                   1.20 kB
dist/assets/index-abc123.css      45.2 kB
dist/assets/index-xyz789.js      425.8 kB
```

---

## üéØ Quick Start Summary

### Fastest Deployment (Vercel)

```bash
# 1. Install Vercel CLI
npm install -g vercel

# 2. Login
vercel login

# 3. Deploy
vercel --prod
```

### Custom Domain Setup

**Vercel:**
1. Go to Project Settings ‚Üí Domains
2. Add your custom domain
3. Update DNS records as instructed

**Netlify:**
1. Go to Site Settings ‚Üí Domain Management
2. Add custom domain
3. Update DNS records as instructed

---

## üîç Troubleshooting

### Build Fails

- Check Node version (requires Node 20+)
- Run `npm install` to ensure dependencies are installed
- Run `npm run check:safe` locally first
- Check build logs for specific errors

### Blank Page After Deployment

- Check browser console for errors
- Verify `base` path in `vite.config.js`
- Ensure routing redirects are configured

### 404 Errors on Page Refresh

- Verify redirect rules are configured:
  - Vercel: Check `vercel.json`
  - Netlify: Check `netlify.toml`

### Environment Variables Not Working

- Use `VITE_` prefix for runtime variables
- Rebuild after adding variables
- Check variable names match exactly

---

## üìä Performance Optimization

Both Vercel and Netlify automatically provide:

‚úÖ **CDN distribution** (global edge network)
‚úÖ **Automatic HTTPS** (SSL certificates)
‚úÖ **Gzip/Brotli compression**
‚úÖ **HTTP/2 support**
‚úÖ **Automatic asset caching**
‚úÖ **DDoS protection**

---

## üéâ Success!

Once deployed, your AI Accountant app will be:

- **Live 24/7** with 99.9% uptime
- **Globally distributed** via CDN
- **Automatically updated** on every push
- **Secured with HTTPS**
- **Optimized for performance**

Share your live URL with users and start accepting payments! üí≥

---

## üìû Support

- **Vercel Docs**: https://vercel.com/docs
- **Netlify Docs**: https://docs.netlify.com
- **GitHub Pages**: https://pages.github.com

For payment integration issues, see `PAYPAL_SETUP.md`.
